definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: [[לאׁ]] or [[לוֹא]]

definitions.title: adv.
definitions.body: not (Ar. la0, Aram. [[לָא]], lo0, Sab. [[לא]], Ass. lâ; not in Eth.: cf. Kö:ii. 1. 236 Walker:AJSL 1896, 237 ff.)—[[לוֹא]], acc. to Mass. (Fr:MM 248), 35 t., besides [[בְּלוֹא]] 6 t., and [[הֲלוֹא]], the orthogr. of which varies much (ib.:p. 251), e.g. in S always [[הֲלוֹא]], in Chr always [[הֲלאׁ]], on the whole [[הֲלוֹא]] 141 t., [[הֲלאׁ]] 128 t.; twice, acc. to Mass., written [[לו]] (Qr [[לאׁ]]), 1Sa 2:16, 1Sa 20:2, once [[לה]] De 3:11 Kt:—not—denying objectively, like ou) (not mh\ = [[אַל]]):—
in predication:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: with a verb; so most freq., and nearly always (a) with the finite tenses, whether pf. (Ge 2:5 b, Ge 4:5 etc.) or impf. (Ge 3:4, Ge 8:21, Ge 8:22, etc.); in short circumst. clauses, as Ge 44:4 [[לא הרחיקו]], Is 40:20 [[לאׁ יִמּוֹט]], and with a final force Is 41:7, Ex 28:32 (v. Ges:§ 156. 3 R. b, c Dr:§ 162). Governing two closely connected verbs (Dr:§ 115, [[לא]]) Ex 28:43 [[וְלאׁ יִשְׂאוּ עָוֹן וׇמֵתוּ]], Le 19:12, Le 19:29 b, De 7:25, De 7:26, De 19:10, De 22:1 al.; and two parallel clauses (Ges:§ 152. 3) Is 23:4 b, Ps 9:19, Ps 44:19, Job 3:1 al. With the impf., esp. with 2 ps., [[לאׁ]] often expresses (not, like [[אַל]], a deprecation, do not…, let not…, but) a prohibition, as Ge 2:17 [[לאׁ תאׁכַל]] [[מִמֶּנּוּ]] thou shall not eat of it, Ge 3:1, Ge 3:3, Ex 20:3 [[לאׁ־יִהְיֶה]] [[לְְ]] there shall not be to thee, etc., v:Ex 20:13 [[לא תגנב]], etc. With the coh. and juss. moods (which are negatived regularly by [[אַל]]), it occurs only exceptionally (Ges:§ 109. 1 b R. 1), Ge 24:8, 1Sa 14:36, 2Sa 17:12, 2Sa 18:14, 1Ki 2:6, Ez Eze 48:14. (b) with the inf. (which is negatived by [[בִּלְתִּי]], q.v.), only once, in [[בְּלאׁ]] (

definitions.title: 4 a
definitions.body: ), and with [[לְ]], in the sense of cannot, or must not; † Ju Jdg 1:19 [[כי לא להורישׁ]] for it was not (possible) to dispossess, etc. Am 6:10 [[לא]] ´[[להזכיר בשׁם י]], 1Ch 5:1, 1Ch 15:2 (Dr:§ 202. 2); cf. Aram. [[לָא]] Da 6:9, Ezr 6:8. On its use with the ptcp., see

definitions.title: b
definitions.body: c. (c) [[לא]] always negatives properly the word immed. following: hence, in a verbal sentence, where this is not the verb, some special stress rests upon it, Ge 32:29 [[לאׁ יַעֲקׂב]] ´[[יֵאָמֵר עוֹד וג]] not Jacob shall thy name be called any more, but Israel, Ge 45:8 [[לאׁ אַתֶּם שְׁלַחְתֶּם אׂתִי]] Not ye (in our idiom: It is not ye who) have sent me hither, but God, Ex 16:8, 1Sa 8:7 [[כִּי לאׁ]] ´[[אׂתְ ְמָאָסוּ כִּי אׂתִי וג]], Ps 115:17; without a foll. correcting clause, Ge 38:9, Nu 16:29 :[[שְׁלָחָנִי]] ´[[לאׁ י]] Not ´[[י]] (but another) hath sent me, De 32:27 [[לאׁ]] [[פָּעַל זאׁת]] ´[[י]], 1Ch 17:4, De 8:9, Is 28:28 …[[לא לנחח]] not for ever (but only for a while)…(so Is 57:16, Ps 9:19, Ps 49:18, Ps 103:9; but Is 13:20 [[לא תשׁב לנחח]] is, will not be inhabited for ever), Is 43:22, Job 13:16, Job 32:9; hence rhetorically, insinuating something very different, not named, 2Ki 6:10 not once, and not twice (but repeatedly), Ezr 10:13, Je 4:11 a wind :[[לאׁ לְזׇרוֹת וְלוֹא לְהָבַֽר]] not to winnow, and not to cleanse (but to exterminate), Is 45:13, Is 48:1 b, Jos 24:12, Da 11:20, Da 11:29, Job 34:20 [[לאׁ בְיׇד]] (but by a Divine agency: cf. Da 2:34; also Job 20:26 [[אֵשׁ לאׁ נֻפָָּךְ]] fire not blown upon [but kindled from heaven], La 4:6; and [[אין]] Is 47:14). (d) standing alone: (a) [[אִם־לאׁ]] if not, Ge 18:21 :[[וְאִם־לאׁ אֵדָֽעָה]], 29:49, Ge 42:16, Job 9:24, Job 24:25; (b) [[אִם־לא]]…[[הֲ]], or not, Ge 24:21 waiting to know [[דַּרְכּוֹ אִם־לאׁ]] ´[[הַהִחְלִיחַ י]], Ge 27:21, Ge 37:32, Ex 16:4, Nu 11:23, De 8:2, Ju Jdg 2:22 (cf. [[אִם אַיִן]], [[אַיִן]]

definitions.title: 2 d
definitions.body: b, d). In answer to a question or request, to deny, or decline, Nay, No: Ju Jdg 12:5 [[ויאמר לא]], Hag 2:12; [[לא אדני]] Ge 23:11, Ge 42:10, 1Sa 1:15 +; oft. sq. [[כי]], No: for…= No: but…, Ge 18:15 [[ויאמר]] [[לאׁ כִּי חָחָָקְתְּ]], Ge 19:2, Jos 5:14, Jos 24:21, 1Sa 2:16, Qr (v. Dr), 1Sa 10:19 (LXX MSS), 2Sa 16:18, 2Sa 24:24, 1Ki 3:22, 1Ki 3:22 +; Job 23:6 (strangely). (Cf., in deprecation, [[אַל]].) (e) with an interrog. force, which however does not lie in [[לא]] as such, but (as in other cases) in the contrast with a preceding clause, or in the tone of voice (cf. [[וְ]]

f; Ew:§ 324 a Ges:§ 150. 1 Dr:1Sa 11:12): Jon 4:11 ´[[וַאֲנִי לאׁ אָחוּס וג]]…[[אַתָּה חַסְתָּ]], Job 2:10; Job 22:11; Ex 8:22; 2Ki 5:26, Je 49:9 (‖ Ob:Ob 5 [[הֲלוֹא]]), Mal 2:15, La 3:38; and in passages, exeg. or text. doubtful (v. Comm.), 1Sa 20:14, 2Sa 23:5 (but v. Bu), Ho 10:9 (Ew We), Ho 11:5 (Ew), Job 14:16 b (but LXX Ew Di [[תַעֲבׂר]]), La 1:12 (Ew Ke), La 3:36 (Ke Bä).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: with adjs. and subst.: (a) Ge 2:18 [[לאׁ טוֹב הֱֶיוֹת הָאָדָם לְבַדּׂו]] not good is man's being alone, Ex 18:17 + oft. (b) Ex 4:16 [[לאׁ אִישׁ דְּבָרִים]] [[אָנׁכִי]], Am 7:14 [[לא נביא אנכי]], Nu 23:9 [[לאׁ אִישׁ אֵל]] [[וִיכַזֵּב]], De 17:15 (v. [[אשׁר]]

b) De 20:20, De 32:47, 1Sa 15:29, 2Sa 18:20 [[לאׁ אִישׁ בְּשׂרָה אַתָּה הַיּוֹם]], 2Sa 21:2, 1Ki 22:33, 2Ki 6:19 [[לא זִה הדרך]], Mic 2:10, Is 27:11, Ho 8:6; [[והמה]] [[לא אלהים]] Je 2:11, Je 16:20, 2Ki 19:18, 1Ki 19:11, 1Ki 19:11 [[לאׁ]] ´[[בָרַעַשׁ י]], De 30:12, De 30:13, Job 15:9, Job 28:14 [[לאׁ בִי הִיא]] (‖[[אֵין]] [[עִמָּדִי]])s, Ps 74:9, Je 5:10 [[המה]] ´[[לוא לי]], Je 10:16; De 32:21 [[בָּנִים לאׁ אֵמוּן בָּם]], Je 10:14, Hb Hab 1:14, Job 16:17, Job 38:26 [[מִדְבָּר לאׁ אָדָם בּוֹ]]; 1Ki 22:17 [[לאׁ אֲדׂנִים לָאֵלֶּה]], Je 49:31, Ps 22:3 [[וְלאׁ דוּמִיׇּה לִי]], Job 18:17, Job 18:19, Job 29:12 [[ולא עׂזֵר לו]], Job 30:13, Job 33:9; Je 2:19 [[וְלאׁ פַחְדָּתִי אֵלַיִךְ]] and (that) my terror reached not unto thee, Job 21:9; abs. Ge 29:7 [[לאׁ־עֵתִ הֵאָסֵף הַמִּקְנֶה]] (Hag 1:2), Nu 20:5, 2Ki 4:23 [[לא חדשׁ ולא שׁבת]], Is 44:9, Je 5:12 [[ויאמרו לוא הוא]], Job 9:32, Job 22:16, Job 36:26, Job 41:2; Pr 19:7 (si vera l.) [[מְרַדֵּף]] [[אֲמָרִים לאׁ־הֵמָּה]] words which are not, which are nought. (c) with the ptcp. [[לאׁ]] is rare, a finite vb. being usu. preferred (Ex 34:7 [[וְנַקִּה לאׁ יְנַקֶּה]]: Ew:§ 320 c Dr:§ 162): 2Sa 3:34 [[יׇדֶי ְלאׁ אֲסֻרוֹת]], Ez Eze 4:14, Eze 22:24, De 28:61, Ps 38:15 [[כְּאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לאׁ שׁׂמֵעַ]] who is not hearing, Job 12:3, Job 13:2 [[לאׁ נׁפֵל אָנׁכִי מִכֶּם]], Zep 3:5 (very anom.); 1Ki 10:21 [[לא]] is prob. text. err. In [[וְהוּא לאׁ שׂנֵא לוֹ]] or [[לא שׂנא הוא לו]], De 4:42, De 19:4, De 19:6, Jos 20:5 (cf. [[אׂיֵב]] Nu 35:23), [[שׂנֵא]] is best construed as a subst., he being a not-hater to him afore-time.—In most of the cases under b, c, [[אין]] could have been employed; but the negation by [[לאׁ]] is more pointed and forcible.
Not in predication:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: coupled to an adj. to negative it, like the Gk. a²-, but usu. by way of litotes: Ho 13:13 [[בן לא־חכם]] an unwise son, Ps 36:5 [[דֶּרֶח לאׁ טוֹב]] a way not good, Ps 43:1 [[גוי לא]] [[חסיד]], Pr 16:29, Pr 30:25, Pr 30:26, Ez Eze 20:25, 2Ch 30:17 : Is 16:14 [[לוֹא כַבִּיר]], cf. Is 10:7 [[לאׁ מְעַט]].

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: with a ptcp. Je 2:2 [[ארץ לא זרועה]], Je 18:15 (the finite verb is more common: see Is 62:12 [[עִיר לאׁ נֱעֶזָ֫בָה]] (cf. Is 54:11), Je 6:8 [[אֶרֶץ לוֹא נוֹשָׁ֫בָה]], Je 15:18, Je 22:6, Je 31:18, Zep 2:1).

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: † Ge 15:13 [[בארץ לא להם]], Je 5:19, Hab 1:6 [[מִשְׁכָּנוֹת לאׁ־לוֹ]], Pr 26:17 [[רִיב לאׁ־לוֹ]].

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: with a subst., in poetry, forming a kind of compound, expressing pointedly its antithesis or negation (Germ. un- is sts. used similarly): De 32:5(?), De 32:17, De 32:21 a they made me jealous [[בְּלאׁ אֵל]] with a not-God (with what in no respect deserved the name of God), v:b [[בְּלאׁ עָם]] i.e. with an unorganized horde, Am 6:13 [[הַשְּׂמֵחִים לְלאׁ בָבָר]] i.e. at a thing wh. is not, an unreality (of their boasted strength), Is 10:15 [[כְּהָרִים]] [[מַטֶּה לאׁ עֵץ]] like a rod's lifting up what is no wood (but the agent wielding it), Is 31:8 [[חרב לא]] [[אישׁ]], [[חרב לא אדם]], Is 55:2 [[בלוא לחם]] for what is not bread, [[בלוא לשׂבעה]] for what is not for satiety, Je 5:7 [[וַיּשָּֽׁבְעוּ בְּלאׁ אֱלֽהִים]] by not-gods, in late prose 2Ch 13:9 [[כּׂהֵן לְלאׁ אֱלֽהִים]]; Ps 44:13 [[תִּמְכּׂר]] [[עַמְּ ְבְּלאׁ־הוֹן]] for no-value (i.e. cheaply), Pr 13:23, Job 10:12 [[חלמות וְלאׁ סְדָרִים]] darkness and disorder; so [[לאׁ־עַמִּי]] Ho 1:9, Ho 2:23: still more pregnantly Job 26:2 a [[מֶה־עָזַרְתָּ לְלאׁ־כׂחַ]] (poet. for [[לאשׁר אין לו כח]]) the powerless, v:Job 26:2; v:Job 26:3 (Ew:§ 286 g Ges:§ 152. 1 n.), Job 39:16 [[הִקְשִׁיחַ בָּנֶיהָ לְלאׁ לָהּ]] useth hardly her young ones (making them) into none of hers; and even Hb Hab 2:6 [[הַמַּרְבֶּה לאׁ־לוֹ]] what is not his own (cf. Job 18:15 [[מִבְּלִי לוֹ]]). Cf. with a verb, and ellipse of [[אשׁר]], Is 65:1 [[לְלאׁ שָׁאָָלוּ]] to those who have not asked, v:b Je 2:8 [[אַחֲרִי לאׁ יוֹעִילוּ]], v:Je 2:11; also [[לאׁ רֻחָ֫מָה]] Ho 1:6, Ho 1:8, Ho 2:23, and prob. Job 31:31 [[לאׁ]] [[נִשְׂבָָּע]] (pf. in p.) one not satisfied.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: in circ. clauses (Dr:§ 164), poet. and rare: qualifying a subst., 2Sa 23:4 [[בּׂקֶר לאׁ עָבוֹת]] a morning without clouds, Job 12:24 [[בְּתׂהוּ לאׁ דֶרֶח]] in a pathless waste, Job 38:26; and a verb Job 34:24 [[יׇרׂעַ כַּבִּרִים לאׁ חֵקֶר]] without inquiry, Ps 59:4 [[לא פשׁעי ולא חטאתי]] (cf. v:Ps 59:4 [[בלי עון]]), in late prose, twice, 1Ch 2:30, 1Ch 2:32 [[וימת]] [[לא בנים]] ([[אֵין]] and [[בְּלִי]], q.v., are more usual in such cases).

Once (acc. to many MSS), as a subst., Job 6:21 [[כִּי־עַתָּה הֱיִיתֶם לאׁ]] for now are ye become nothing, Hi De Kö (cf. Da 4:32 (Aram.) [[כְּלָה]] [[חֲשִׁיבִין]], Targum here [[כְּלָא]] [[הֲוֵיתוּן]], and [[אַל]] Job 24:25); but reading fluctuates (Orientals [[לאׁ]], Qr [[לו]], Westerns, Baer (v. pp. 37, 56) [[לוֹ]] [‘now are ye become that,’ viz. the [[נַחַל אַכְזׇב]] of v:Job 24:15]; but even [[לוֹ]] yields a forced sense; and text is prob. wrong: Mich Ew Ol Sgf Bu [[לִי]]…[[כֵּן]] (LXX SyrVer also rd. [[לִי]]); Bö Di [[לְאָָיִן]]…[[כִּי]]. Cf. Ko:ii. 1. 236 f.
With prefixes:—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: † [[בְּלאׁ]]:31 (chiefly poet. or late), acc. to the varying signif. of [[בְּ]]: (a) usu. with not = without, Je 22:13 [[בונה ביתו בלא־]] [[חדק]] without justice (‖[[בלא משׁפט]]; so Ez Eze 22:29, Pr 16:8), Is 55:1, Is 55:1; Pr 19:2, Job 8:11 [[הֲיִגְאֶה־גּׁמֶא בְּלאׁ]] [[בִצָּה]] without mire ‖[[כלי מים]], Job 30:28 [[בְּלאׁ חַמָּה]] (=not through the sun), La 1:6 [[וילכו בלא־כח]], Nu 35:22 [[בְּלאׁ חְדִיׇּה]] …[[בְּלאׁ אֵיבָה ]], v:Nu 35:23 (sq. inf.) [[בְּלאׁ רְאוֹת]], 2Ch 21:20, Ec 10:11; Ps 17:1 [[תְּפִלָּתִי בְּלאׁ]] [[שִׂפְתֵי מִרְמָה]]; used more freely in Chr, 1Ch 12:18 :[[בְּלאׁ חָמָס בְּכַפָּֽי]], v:Nu 35:34 [[בְּלאׁ לֵב וׇלֵב]], 2Ch 30:18 [[בְּלאׁ כַכָּתוּב]]. With ellipse of rel., La 4:14 [[בְּלאׁ]] [[יוּכְלוּ יִגְּעוּ]] without (that) men are able to touch, etc. (b) of time, in not, i.e. outside of, Le 15:25 [[בלא עֶת־נִדָּתָêח]], before Job 15:32 [[בלא־יומו]], Ec 7:17 :[[בְּלאׁ עִתֶּךְ ]]. (c) where [[לאׁ]] belongs to the foll. word, and is only accidentally preceded by [[ב]] (v. supr.

definitions.title: 2 d
definitions.body: ), De 32:21, De 32:21, Je 5:7, Pr 13:23 [[בלא משׁפט]] through injustice; with [[בְּ]] pretii, Ps 44:13, Is 55:2, Is 55:2, Je 2:11 [[בְּלוֹא יוֹעִיל]] for (that which) profiteth not.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: [[הֲלאׁ]] nonne ? Ge 4:7 + oft. Inviting, as it does, an affirmative answer, it is often used, (a) esp. in conversation, for pointing to a fact in such a way as to arouse the interest of the person addressed, or to win his assent: Ge 13:19 Is not the whole land before thee ? Ge 19:20, Ge 20:5, Ge 27:36, Ge 29:25, Ex 4:11 Who maketh dumb or deaf, etc. Do not I ? Ex 33:16, Ju Jdg 4:6, Jdg 4:14, Jdg 8:2, Jdg 9:28, Jdg 9:38, 1Sa 9:20, 1Sa 9:21, 1Sa 15:17 etc.; with a vb. in 1 ps., Jos 1:9 [[הלא חויתיך]], Ju Jdg 6:14 [[הלא שׁלחתיך]], 1Sa 20:30, 2Sa 19:23, Ru 2:9: similarly in a poet. or rhet. style, Ju Jdg 5:30 [[הלא ימחאו יחלקו שׁלל]], Is 8:19, Is 10:8, Is 10:9, Is 10:11, Is 28:25, Is 29:17, Is 40:21, Is 40:23, Is 42:24, Is 43:19 etc., Job 4:6, Job 4:21, Job 7:1, Job 10:10, Job 10:20, etc. (b) it has a tendency to become little more than an affirm. particle, declaring with some rhetor. emph. what is, or might be, well known: De 3:11 [[הֲלֽה הִיא בְרַבַּת בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן]], De 11:30, 1Sa 21:12 [[הלוא]] ´[[זה דוד וג]] (cf. 1Sa 29:3, 1Sa 29:5, 2Sa 11:3), 1Sa 23:19, 1Sa 26:1, 2Sa 15:35; it is thus nearly = [[הִנֵּה]] (LXX sts. represents it by idou, as Jos 1:9, Ju Jdg 6:14, Ru 2:9, 2Sa 15:35); so esp. in the phrase of the compiler of K, And the rest of the acts of…, [[כְּתוּבִים]] ([[הֵמָּה]])[[הֲלאׁ הֵם ]] are they not written in, etc. ? 1Ki 11:41, 1Ki 14:29 + oft. (with which there interchanges [[הִנׇּם כְּתוּבִים]] 1Ki 14:19, 2Ki 15:11, 2Ki 15:26, 2Ki 15:31, which is gen. used by the Chr, 2Ch 16:11, 2Ch 20:34, etc.), Jos 10:13 (cf. 2Sa 1:18 [[הִנֵּה]]), 1Ki 8:53 LXX, Es 10:2; Ps 56:14 (strangely: contr. Ps 116:8).—[[הֲלאׁ הִנֵּה]] † Hb Hab 2:13, 2Ch 25:26 ([[הִנׇּם]]).—On Ju Jdg 14:15, see [[הֲ]]
end.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: † [[êׇול֕אׁ]] and not=and if not, 2Sa 13:26, 2Ki 5:17. Comp. [[וׇּיֵשׁ]].

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: † [[כְּלוֹא]] Ob:Ob 16 [[והיו כלוא היו]], poet. for [[כאשׁר]], as though they had not been.

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: † [[לְלאׁ]] without, lit. in the condition of no…2Ch 15:3 (comp. [[לְאֵין]], also in Chr). Elsewhere [[לא]] belongs to the foll. word, Am 6:13, 2Ch 13:9, Is 65:1, Is 65:1, Job 26:2, Job 26:3, Job 39:16 (v. supr.

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note.—Fifteen times, acc. to Mas. (v. De:Ps 100. 3 Fr:MM 247 Str:Prol. Cr. 84), [[לא]] is written by error for [[לוֹ]], viz. Ex 21:8, Le 11:21, Le 25:30, 1Sa 2:3, 2Sa 16:18, 2Ki 8:10, Is 9:2, Is 63:9, Ps 100:3, Ps 139:16, Job 13:15, Job 41:4, Pr 19:7, Pr 26:2, Ezr 4:2 (always with Qr [[לוֹ]]). The passages must be considered each upon its own merits: in some [[לוֹ]] yields a preferable sense; but this is not the case in all. There is the same [[קרי]] (rightly) on Is 49:5, 1Ch 11:20; but these were not considered to rest upon equal authority, and are hence not reckoned with the fifteen.—In Ju Jdg 21:22 (v. GFM), 1Sa 13:13, 1Sa 20:14, 1Sa 20:14, and in Job 9:33 [[לאׁ יֵשׁ]], rd. prob. [[לֻא]] for [[לאׁ]].
